note.text: Three major mountain ranges define the geography of Pakistan.

- The Himalayas divide South Asia from China. They reach into northern Pakistan.
- The Hindu Kush run along the border with Afghanistan. The Khyber Pass, a traditional route between South and Central Asia, runs through these mountains.
- The Karakoram range is in the northeast, near the disputed Kashmir border. K2, the second-highest peak in the world, is in this range.
Both India and Pakistan depend on water from the Indus River, which flows from north to south for almost all of Pakistan's length.
